content: मात्र {%<ab>a.</ab>%} (त्रा, --त्री|{%<ab>f.</ab>%}) [मा-त्रन्] An affix added to nouns in the sense of ‘measuring as much as’, ‘as high or long, or broad as,’ ‘reaching as far as;’ as in ऊरुमात्री भित्तिः पंचदशयोजनमात्रमध्वानमतिचक्राम <ls>K.</ls>; (in this sense the word may as well be considered to be मात्रा at the end of <ab>comp.</ab> <ab>q. v.</ab> below). --त्रं {@--1@} A measure, whether of length, breadth, height, size, space, distance or number; usually at the end of <ab>comp.</ab> {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} अंगुलिमात्रं a ‘finger's breadth’; किंचिन्मात्रं गत्वा ‘to some distance’; क्रोशमात्रे ‘at the distance of a Krośa’, रेखामात्रमपि ‘even the breadth of a line, as much as a line’; <ls>R. 1. 17</ls>; so क्षणमात्र, नि मिषमात्रं ‘the space of an instant;’ शतमात्र ‘a hundred in number’; so गजमात्र ‘as high or big as an elephant’; तालम त्र, यवमात्र &c. {@--2@} The full measure of anything, the whole or entire class of things, totality; जीवमात्र or प्राणिमात्रं ‘the entire class of living beings’; मनुष्यमात्रो मर्त्यः ‘every man is mortal’; वस्तुमात्रपक्षकोऽनुप पंहारी (हेतुः) <ls>Tarka K.</ls>; मानुषमात्रदुष्करं कर्मानुष्ठितं <ls>Dk.</ls> {@--3@} The simple measure of anything, the one thing and no more, often translateable by ‘mere,’ ‘only’, ‘even’; जातिमात्रेण <ls>H. 1. 58</ls> ‘by mere caste’; टिट्टिभमात्रेण समुद्रो व्याकुलीकृतः <ls n="H.">2. 149.</ls> ‘by a mere wag-tail’, वाचामात्रेण जाप्यसे <ls>Ś. 2</ls> ‘merely by words’; so अर्थमात्रं, संमानमात्रं <ls>Pt. 1. 83</ls>; used with past participles मात्र may be translated by ‘as soon as’, ‘no sooner than’, ‘just’; विद्धमात्रः <ls>R. 5. 51</ls> ‘as soon as pierced’, ‘when just pierced’; भुक्तामात्रे ‘just after eating’; प्रविष्टमात्र एव तत्रमवति <ls>Ś. 3.</ls> &c.

मात्रा {@--1@} A measure; see मात्रं above. {@--2@} A standard of measure, standard, rule. {@--3@} The correct measure. {@--4@} A unit of measure, a foot. {@--5@} A moment. {@--6@} A particle, an atom. {@--7@} A part, portion: सुरेंद्रमात्राश्रितगौरवत्वात् <ls>R. 3. 11.</ls> {@--8@} A small portion, a little, trifle, a little quantity, a small measure only, see मात्र (3). {@--9@} Account, consideration; राजेति कियती मात्रा <ls>Pt. 1. 40</ls> ‘of what account or consideration is a king’, {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} I hold him of no account; कायस्थ इति लघ्वी मात्रा <ls>Mu. 1.</ls> {@--10@} Money, wealth; property. शून्यमठिकायां मात्राः समवतार्य <ls>Dk.</ls>; नक्तदिनं कक्षांतरात्तां मात्रां न मुंचति <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; कथमस्यार्थमात्रा हर्तव्या {%<ab>ibid.</ab>%} {@--11@} (In prosody) A prosodial or syllabic instant, the time required to pronounce a short vowel. {@--12@} An element. {@--13@} The material world, matter. {@--14@} The upper part of the Nāgarī characters. {@--15@} An ear-ring. {@--16@} An ornament; a jewel. {@--17@} A measure of time (in music). {@--18@} Function of the organs (इंद्रियवृत्ति).
